      The   City Journal              
          (USPS: 114-540)             
         Published Weekly             
        Under Authority of            
    City Ordinance No. 30050          
        by City of St. Louis          
     Parrie L. May, Register          
       1206 Market Street             
       Room 118 City Hall             
    St. Louis, Missouri 63103         
 Yearly Subscription . . . . $26.00   
         IN ADVANCE                   
 Copies for sale and distribution at  
       Room 118 City Hall             
    Periodicals postage paid at       
        St. Louis, Missouri           
Postmaster: send address              
changes to City Journal, Register's   
Office. 1206 Market Street, Room      
118, St. Louis, Missouri, 63103.      
      JOURNAL                    
       OF THE                    
 Board of                        
 Aldermen                        
      OF THE                     
 CITY OF ST. LOUIS               
      REGULAR                    
       SESSION                   
      2002-2003                  
 PRELIMINARY                     
 The Board of Aldermen is        
 currently not in session.       
 Meetings will resume on         
      April 14, 2003.            
   BOARD OF                                     
 PUBLIC SERVICE                                 
         Regular Meeting                        
 St. Louis, MO - February 25, 2003              
      Board met at 1:45 P.M.                    
      Present: Directors Suelmann, Siedhoff,    
 Bess, Stallworth, Simon and President Hearst.  
      Absent: Directors Visintainer and         
 Griggs. (excused)                              
       Requests of the Director of Public       
 Utilities to be excused from the Regular       
 Meeting designating Mr. James Kummer to        
 act in his behalf; Director of Airport to be   
 excused from the Regular Meeting of            
 February 25, 2003 designating Mr. Don Huber    
 to act in his behalf were received and leave of
 absence granted.                               
      Minutes of the Regular Meeting of         
 February 18, 2003 were unanimously             
 approved.                                      
      The following documents were referred     
 by the Secretary:                              
            February 21, 2003                   
      To the Directors of Public Utilities and  
 Streets: 107339, Charter Communications, cut   
 or bore for the purpose of installing          
 communication system on Clayton and            
 Graham. 107340, Charter Communications,        
 cut or bore for the purpose of installing      
 communication system on Manchester and         
 Ecoff.                                         
107341, Charter Communications, cut or bore       
for the purpose of installing communication       
system at 6211 Scanlan. 107342, Charter           
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system on             
Southwest and Ellendale. 107343, Charter          
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system on Sulphur     
and Southwest. 107344, Charter                    
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system at 1300        
S. 9th. 107345, Charter Communications, cut       
or bore for the purpose of installing             
communication system on 10th and Park.            
107346, Charter Communications, cut or bore       
for the purpose of installing communication       
system on 8th and Geyer. 107347, Charter          
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system on Victor      
and       Menard.      107348,       Charter      
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system on             
Nebraska and Allen. 107349, Charter               
Communications, cut or bore for the purpose       
of installing communication system at 3539        
Hartford. 107350, Charter Communications,         
cut or bore for the purpose of installing         
communication system on Kemper and                
Hereford. 107351, Charter Communications,         
cut or bore for the purpose of installing         
communication system on Arsenal and               
Hereford. 107352, Charter Communications,         
cut or bore for the purpose of installing         
communication system at 3186 59th St.             
107353, Charter Communications, cut or bore       
for the purpose of installing communication       
system on Macklind and Manchester.                
      To the Directors of Public Utilities,       
Streets, Parks, Recreation and Forestry &         
Health and Hospitals: 107073, Fair St. Louis,     
amend permit to hold fair July 3-5, 2003 to       
include the grounds of the Casino Queen in        
St. Louis, and also the traffic deck on the Eads  
Bridge and it's eat and west approaches.          
     To the Directors of Public Utilities and     
Public Safety: 107354, Prospect Hill Baptist      
Church, consolidate tracts of land in Block 12    
of West Harney Hts. First Addition in             
C.B. 5562. 107355, Quiktrip Corporation,          
subdivide property in C.B. 4699-N on              
Gravois at Quincy and Loughborough. 107356,       
Pyramid Construction Co., subdivide               
Lots 13-15 of St. Wenceslaus Subdivision in       
C.B. 1983, 3015-19 Ohio. 107357, Pyramid          
Construction Co., subdivide Lots 20-21 in         
C.B. 1999 at 2920-22 Pennsylvania. 107358,        
Pyramid Construction Co., subdivide               
Lots 11-12 in C.B. 2077 at 2621-23 Oregon.        
107359, Permacel St. Louis, Inc., subdivide       
land at 1401 Central Ind. Dr. Outlot 98.          
        To the Director of Streets: Petition No.  
 6566, Board of Police Commissioners, vacate      
 eastern 336' of the 15' wide e/w alley in C.B.   
 216 bounded by Clark, Tucker, Spruce and         
 14th . Petition No. 6567, Hopewell M.B.          
 Church, vacate an irregular width n/s alley and  
 435' 10' portion of an irregular shaped e/w      
 alley in C.B. 3761 bounded by McMillan,          
 Taylor, Enright, Walton and Kensington.          
 107360, Cinco de Mayo Festival, hold event       
 on Cherokee Street, May 4, 2003.                 
       To the Directors of Streets and Public     
 Safety: 107361, Ching Ching's Restaurant,        
 encroach with handicap ramp at 3332 N. 19th.     
 107362, Cornerstone Construction Co.,            
 construct wheelchair ramp at 2705 S.             
 Jefferson. 107363, Conrad Properties Corp.,      
 encroach with stairs and ramps at 4535-69        
 Forest Park.                                     
      To the Directors of Health and Hospitals    
 and Public Safety: 107364, Cochran Garden        
 Child Development, conduct day care center       
 at 1121 N. 8th, 1st floor. 107365, Purvey and    
 Porter Small World Day Care Center, conduct      
 day care center at 1902 N. Union. 107366,        
 The Charless Home, conduct nursing home at       
 4431 S. Broadway. 107106, Majic Moments          
 Learning Center, amend capacity to conduct       
 day care center at 8780 and 8780 N. Broadway     
 to 49 children per shift - adding 15 infant/     
 toddlers. 107367, Learn-N-Leap, Inc., conduct    
 day care center at 3315 Meramec. 107368,         
 Susan D. Wyatt, operate massage and/or           
 public bath establishment at 1002 Hi-Pointe.     
 107369, Rich and Little Preschool, conduct       
 day care center at 4337 Shreve.                  
                 LETTINGS                         
      Three sealed proposals for the public       
 work advertised under Letting No. 8203 -         
 CMAQ III Traffic Signal Installation Plan        
 "H", and; Three under Letting No. 8205 -         
 Residential Sound Insulation Program Part XX     
 at Lambert, were received, publicly opened,      
 read and referred to the President.              
                 HEARINGS                         
      Hearing No. 8051 - Wilson Taxicab Co.,      
 to show cause why Permit No. 99474 to            
 operate a taxicab company in the City of St.     
 Louis should not be revoked for failure to       
 provide a valid Certificate of Insurance as      
 required by Ordinance, permit ordered            
 reinstated, subject to the approval of the       
 insurance by the City Counselor's Office and     
 subject to Wilson Taxicab Co. getting a          
 telephone solely for the cab company.            
      Hearing No. 8052 - Eric Brende, operate     
 a pedicab service in the City of St. Louis,      
 ordered approved, subject to certain conditions  
 and subject to the provisions of the Horse-      
 drawn carriage ordinance.                        
      Communications, reports, recommend-       
 ations and documents were submitted by         
 Board Members and action thereon taken as      
 follows:                                       
                PRESIDENT                       
      Detailed plans and specifications for the 
 following work approved, and Board set the     
 date of April 1, 2003 for opening bids for     
 work and Secretary instructed to insert the    
 proper advertisement therefore:                
      Letting No. 8210 - Taxiway A,             
 Taxiway S, Taxilane Reconstruction at Lambert  
      Preliminary approval ordered given and    
 10 days granted in which to sign same:         
      Letting No. 8200 - Lindell Avenue         
 Pedestrian Lighting, TGB, Inc., P.O. Box 6030, 
 St. Louis, MO 63139, Amount: $898,321.80       
      Proposed contract and bond ordered        
 approved as follows:                           
       Letting No. 8194 - Runway 12R-30L        
 Platform General Grading, Area A, Package      
 5/6 at Lambert, Dave Kolb Grading, Inc., 5733  
 Westwood, St. Charles, MO 63304, Contract      
 No. 19558.                                     
      Addendum No. 4 to the plans and           
 specifications for Letting No. 8204 - Yeatman  
 Park Ward Improvements, approved and           
 made part of the original plans and changing   
 bid opening date to March 4, 2003.             
       Addendum No. 1 to the plans and          
 specifications for Letting No. 8207 - St. Louis
 Gateway Transportation Center, Bi-State        
 Metro Bus Facility approved and made part      
 of the original plans.                         
      Supplemental Agreement No. 2 to P.S.A.    
 No. 963 with CH2MHill for Forest Park          
 Avenue - Kingshighway to DeBaliviere           
 approved and President authorized to execute   
 same.                                          
      List of Emergency Work Orders issued      
 for the month of January 2003 by the           
 Department of the President, Board of Public   
 Service ordered approved.                      
      Board declared as emergency work for      
 Series No. 15C - Commercial Demolition         
 (Gategourmet/Dobbs Houses, Inc.) at            
 Lambert.                                       
 PRESIDENT AND DIRECTORS OF                     
  PUBLIC UTILITIES, STREETS,                    
  PARKS AND PUBLIC SAFETY                       
       Application No. 107253, David Mason      
 and Associates, for final plans and technical  
 specifications for the Near South Side         
 Redevelopment Project - Phase 4B Public        
 Improvements, ordered approved, subject to     
 certain conditions.                            
      DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC                         
      UTILITIES AND STREETS                       
     1 permit for Charter Communications          
and 2 for Southwestern Bell to install            
communication systems ordered approved            
subject to certain conditions: 107322, 10th and   
Walnut; 107325, Buckingham and North              
Court; 107324, Spring and Washington.             
     3 permits ordered approved for Union         
Electric d/b/a AmerenUE, subject to certain       
conditions: 107255, 3317 Liberty; 107254,         
3801 Clarence/3800 N. Newstead; 107320,           
1009 Olive                                        
      Application No. 107323, Union Electric      
d/b/a AmerenUE, set three poles along west        
side of Morganford b/t Federer and Rosa and       
install light on existing pole on Rosa, ordered   
denied, there are no existing poles and overhead  
wires along Morganford on either side of the      
street. No "new" poles are to be set along        
streetscape, only replacement poles.              
     DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC                          
 UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SAFETY                      
     3 subdivisions ordered approved as           
follows, subject to certain conditions: 107354,   
Prospect Hills Baptist Church, 4533               
Arlington; 107219, Etzel Place IV, LP, C.B.       
3814W; 107216, Etzel Place IV, LP, C.B. 3813      
     DIRECTORS OF STREETS,                        
     PARKS, RECREATION AND                        
         FORESTRY AND                             
     HEALTH AND HOSPITALS                         
     Application No. 107307, Downtown St.         
Louis Partnership and Mardi Gras, Inc., hold      
Mardi Gras Family Viewing Area in Kiener          
Plaza and May Amphitheater March 1, 2003          
ordered approved, subject to certain              
conditions.                                       
    DIRECTORS OF PARKS,                           
  RECREATION AND FORESTRY                         
  AND HEALTH AND HOSPITALS                        
     Application No. 107309, Shrine of St.        
Joseph's Friends, to hold event in Father         
Edward J. Filipiak Park June 8, 2003, ordered     
approved, subject to certain conditions.          
  DIRECTORS OF HEALTH AND                         
HOSPITALS AND PUBLIC SAFETY                       
      4 day care centers and 1 residential care   
facility ordered approved as follows: 107202,     
Developmental Child Care, Inc., 1211-19           
Tamm; 106766, The Salvation Army, 3740            
Marine; 107006, Southside Day Nursery,            
2930 and 3012 Iowa; 107249, Grace Hill            
Howard Branch, 1819 N. 22nd; 107125, Saddler      
Residential Care Facility, 730 Hodiamont          
   DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SAFETY                      
      Application No. 107334, Robert              
 Anderson, operate a pool hall at 2725 Dr.        
 Martin Luther King to be known as                
 Champions Billiards, ordered approved,           
 subject to certain conditions.                   
      7 Conditional Use Permits ordered           
 approved, as submitted by the Hearing            
 Officer, per Board Order No. 766.                
      The Dance Hall permit issued to Club        
 Liquid at 326 S. 21st ordered revoked,           
 immediately, with findings of facts being sent   
 to permittee within 10 days.                     
      The following documents were not listed     
 on the posted Agenda: 263515, 263517-26          
 and 263529-33.                                   
     Adjourned to meet               Tuesday,     
 March 4, 2003 at 1:45 P.M.                       
                 Ronald A. Hearst, P.E.           
                 President                        
 ATTEST:                                          
                 Darlene A. Plump,                
                 Secretary                        
   REQUEST FOR                                    
  QUALIFICATIONS                                  
       CITY OF ST. LOUIS                          
    BOARD OF PUBLIC SERVICE                       
      The City of St. Louis invites interested    
 firms to submit Statement of Qualifications      
 (SOQ) to provide DESIGN SERVICES FOR             
 NEW WEST AIRCRAFT RESCUE FIRE                    
 FIGHTING        (ARFF)        BUILDING,          
 LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS INTERNATIONAL                  
 AIRPORT EXPANSION PROGRAM.                       
      The City of St. Louis has established       
 DBE participation goal of 35% for this           
 project.                                         
      The Request for Qualifications package      
 may be obtained from BPS website                 
 www.stlbps.org under Contracts & Bids,           
 Professional Services; by picking the RFQ up     
 at Board of Public Service, 1200 Market Street,  
 Room 327 City Hall, St. Louis, MO 63103;         
 or by calling Bette Behan at 314-589-6214        
 during the hours of 8am-5pm commencing           
 February 24, 2003.                               
        Statements of Qualifications will be      
 received no later than 5:00 p.m., Thursday,      
 March 13, 2003, at BPS at the same address       
 as listed above.                                 
       The Board of Public Service reserves the   
 right to accept or reject any or all responses,  
 or to cancel this request in part or in its      
 entirety.                                        
             Office of the                        
        Board of Public Service                   
           City of St. Louis                      
       Sealed Proposals will be received for the  
 Public Work hereinafter mentioned at the         
 Office of the Board of Public Service, Room      
 208, City Hall, until 1:45 p.m., April 1, 2003,  
 St. Louis, Missouri time, at which time whey     
 will be publicly opened and read, viz:           
 Letting No. 8211: Lambert-St. Louis              
 International Airport Expansion Program,         
 Missouri Bottom Road and Lindbergh North         
 of Tunnel                                        
 Deposit: $370,200.00                             
       The bid package will be available for      
 purchase from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday     
 through Friday commencing February 24,           
 2003, through INDOX Services, One                
 Document Drive, St. Louis, MO 63114              
 (Phone: 314-810-5900) upon payment of            
 $114.00 plus shipping, if required. Purchased    
 sets become the property of the prospective      
 bidder and no refunds will be made.              
      A pre-bid conference will be held at 2:30   
 p.m., March 4, 2003, at the Airport Program      
 Management Office, PAC Room, Riverport           
 Lakes East, 13723 Riverport Drive, Maryland      
 Heights, MO 63043.                               
       Proposals must be made on blank forms      
 to be furnished by the President of the Board    
 of Public Service, and must be submitted to      
 Room 208, City Hall.                             
       Each bidder shall specify in its proposal  
 in figures, without interlineations, alternations
 or erasures, a unit price for each of those items
 where so called for in the proposal, and shall   
 show the products of the respective unit prices  
 and estimated quantities. Bidder shall also      
 show in figures bid proposals for all items on   
 which lump sum figures are requested, and, in    
 addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Total
 Bid Amount for which he will perform all of      
 the estimated work as requested by the general   
 requirements and covenants, specifications       
 and plans.                                       
       In case of a discrepancy between the       
 gross sum shown in the proposal and that         
 obtained by the addition of each item, the latter
 shall prevail.                                   
      Each bid must be accompanied by a           
 Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or      
 Trust Company in the City of St. Louis,          
 payable to the order of the City Treasurer or    
 a Surety Bond approved by the Comptroller        
 of the City of St. Louis for the amount of       
 Deposit required, as heretofore stated.          
       All work under this contract will be paid  
 for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the   
 work completed, less a retained amount of        
5%. Final Payment, including all retained         
percentages, will be made within ten (10) days    
after completion of all work and final            
acceptance by the City.                           
      The City of St. Louis will affirmatively    
insure that in any contract entered into          
pursuant to this advertisement, fully certified   
Disadvantaged Business Enterprises will be        
afforded full opportunity to submit bids in       
response to this invitation and will not be       
discriminated against on the grounds of race,     
color or national origin in consideration for an  
award. The Disadvantaged Business                 
Enterprise goal for this project is 41%.          
      The contract shall provide that not less    
than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the   
City of St. Louis as determined by the            
Department of Labor and Industrial Relations      
of the State of Missouri and the Federal Davis    
Bacon Wage Decision for each craft or type of     
workmen needed in the actual construction         
work on the site of the construction job herein   
authorized, as well as the general prevailing     
rate and federal rate for legal holiday and       
overtime work shall be paid to all workmen.       
     All labor to be performed under this         
contract shall be subject to the provisions of    
Sections 290.210 to 290.340 inclusive, of the     
Revised Statues of Missouri, 1986.                
      The right of the Board of Public Service    
to reject any or all bids is expressly reserved.  
   By order of the Board of Public Service,       
FEBRUARY 25, 2003.                                
                 Ronald A. Hearst, P.E.           
                 President                        
ATTEST:                                           
                 Darlene A. Plump,                
                 Secretary                        
            Office of the                         
       Board of Public Service                    
          City of St. Louis                       
      SEALED PROPOSALS will be received           
for the Public Work hereinafter mentioned at      
the Office of the Board of Public Service,        
Room 208, City Hall, until 1:45 P.M.              
April 1, 2003 St. Louis, Missouri time, at        
which time they will be publicly opened and       
read, viz:                                        
LETTING NO. 8210: TAXIWAY A,                      
TAXIWAY     S,   TAXILANE   D                     
RECONSTRUCTION at LAMBERT ST.                     
LOUIS INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT                       
DEPOSIT: $252,000.00                              
     Plans, specifications and general            
information may be obtained in the Office of      
the Assistant Director of Airports for            
Planning/Engineering, Room MT-1296,               
 Airport Main Terminal, Lambert-St. Louis           
 International Airport, from 8:30 AM to 4:00        
 PM, Monday through Friday and upon                 
 payment of ONE HUNDRED FIFTY dollars               
 ($150.00) for each package. Purchased sets         
 become the property of the prospective bidder      
 and no refunds will be made. Information           
 concerning this project may be obtained by         
 telephoning (314) 426-8015.                        
       Proposals must be made on blank forms        
 to be furnished by the President of the Board      
 of Public Service, and must be submitted to        
 Room 208, City Hall.                               
       Each bidder shall specify in his proposal    
 in figures, without interlineations, alterations   
 or erasures, a unit price for each of those items  
 where so called for in the proposal, and shall     
 show the products of the respective unit prices    
 and estimated quantities. He shall also show       
 in figures bid proposals for all items on which    
 Lump Sum figures are requested, and, in            
 addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Lump   
 Sum for which he will perform all of the           
 estimated work, as requested by the general        
 requirements and covenants, specifications         
 and plans.                                         
      In case of a discrepancy between the          
 gross sum shown in the proposal and that           
 obtained by the addition of the bid prices as      
 applied to be basic items, the latter shall        
 prevail. Each bid must be accompanied by a         
 Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or        
 Trust Company in the City of Saint Louis,          
 payable to the order of the City Treasurer,        
 for the amount of Deposit required, as             
 heretofore stated.                                 
       All work under this contract will be paid    
 for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the     
 work completed, less a retained amount of          
 ten percent (10%). Final payment, including        
 all retained percentages, will be made within      
 ten (10) days after completion of all work         
 and final acceptance by the City.                  
       "The City of St. Louis hereby notifies       
 all bidders that it will affirmatively insure      
 that in any contract entered into pursuant to      
 this advertisement, minority business              
 enterprises will be afforded full opportunity      
 to submit bids in response to this invitation      
 and will not be discriminated against on the       
 grounds of race, color or national origin in       
 consideration for an award." The                   
 Disadvantaged Business Enterprise Goal for         
 this project is 20%.                               
       The contract shall provide that not less     
 than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the    
 City of St. Louis as determined by the             
 Department of Labor and Industrial Relations       
 of the State of Missouri for each craft or type    
 of workmen needed in the actual construction       
 work on the site of the construction job herein  
 authorized, as well as the general prevailing    
 rate for legal holiday and overtime work shall   
 be paid to all workmen.                          
      All labor to be performed under this        
 contract shall be subject to the provisions of   
 Sections 290.210 to 290.340 inclusive, of the    
 Revised Statutes of Missouri, 1986.              
       The right of the Board of Public Service   
 to reject any or all bids is expressly reserved. 
    By order of the Board of Public Service,      
 FEBRUARY 25, 2003.                               
                  Ronald A. Hearst, P.E.          
                  President                       
 ATTEST:                                          
                  Darlene A. Plump,               
                  Secretary                       
             Office of the                        
        Board of Public Service                   
           City of St. Louis                      
      Sealed Proposals will be received for the   
 Public Work hereinafter mentioned at the         
 Office of the Board of Public Service,           
 Room 208, City Hall, until 1:45 p.m.,            
 March 18, 2003, St. Louis, Missouri time, at     
 which time whey will be publicly opened and      
 read, viz:                                       
 Letting No. 8206: Lambert-St. Louis              
 International Airport Expansion Program,         
 Central Stores Buildings, Package 2              
 Deposit: $180,000.00                             
       The bid package will be available for      
 purchase from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.,            
 Monday through Friday commencing                 
 February 10, 2003, through INDOX Services,       
 One Document Drive, St. Louis, MO 63114          
 (Phone: 314-810-5900) upon payment of            
 $100.00 plus shipping, if required. Purchased    
 sets become the property of the prospective      
 bidder and no refunds will be made.              
      A pre-bid conference will be held at        
 2:30 p.m., February 19, 2003, at the Airport     
 Program Management Office, PAC Room,             
 Riverport Executive Center 1, 13723              
 Riverport Drive, Maryland Heights, MO            
 63043.                                           
       Proposals must be made on blank forms      
 to be furnished by the President of the Board    
 of Public Service, and must be submitted to      
 Room 208, City Hall.                             
       Each bidder shall specify in its proposal  
 in figures, without interlineations, alternations
 or erasures, a unit price for each of those items
 where so called for in the proposal, and shall   
 show the products of the respective unit prices  
 and estimated quantities. Bidder shall also      
show in figures bid proposals for all items on     
which lump sum figures are requested, and, in      
addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Total  
Bid Amount for which he will perform all of        
the estimated work as requested by the general     
requirements and covenants, specifications         
and plans.                                         
      In case of a discrepancy between the         
gross sum shown in the proposal and that           
obtained by the addition of each item, the latter  
shall prevail.                                     
     Each bid must be accompanied by a             
Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or        
Trust Company in the City of St. Louis,            
payable to the order of the City Treasurer or      
a Surety Bond approved by the Comptroller          
of the City of St. Louis for the amount of         
Deposit required, as heretofore stated.            
      All work under this contract will be paid    
for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the     
work completed, less a retained amount of          
5%. Final Payment, including all retained          
percentages, will be made within ten (10) days     
after completion of all work and final             
acceptance by the City.                            
      The City of St. Louis will affirmatively     
insure that in any contract entered into           
pursuant to this advertisement, fully certified    
Disadvantaged Business Enterprises will be         
afforded full opportunity to submit bids in        
response to this invitation and will not be        
discriminated against on the grounds of race,      
color or national origin in consideration for an   
award. The Disadvantaged Business                  
Enterprise goal for this project is 25%.           
      The contract shall provide that not less     
than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the    
City of St. Louis as determined by the             
Department of Labor and Industrial Relations       
of the State of Missouri and the Federal Davis     
Bacon Wage Decision for each craft or type of      
workmen needed in the actual construction          
work on the site of the construction job herein    
authorized, as well as the general prevailing      
rate and federal rate for legal holiday and        
overtime work shall be paid to all workmen.        
     All labor to be performed under this          
contract shall be subject to the provisions of     
Sections 290.210 to 290.340 inclusive, of the      
Revised Statues of Missouri, 1986.                 
      The right of the Board of Public Service     
to reject any or all bids is expressly reserved.   
   By order of the Board of Public Service,        
FEBRUARY 4, 2003.                                  
                 Ronald A. Hearst, P.E.            
                 President                         
ATTEST:                                            
                 Darlene A. Plump,                 
                 Secretary                         
    PUBLIC NOTICE                                 
      A public hearing will be held by the        
 Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on              
 Wednesday, March 12, 2003, in Room 208           
 City Hall to consider the following:             
      APPEAL 8153 - Appeal filed by James         
 Engineering, from the determination of the       
 Board of Public Service in the denial of a       
 subdivision plat authorizing the Appellant to    
 subdivide Lots 4 -5 in Block 3 of S.R. Barlow's  
 Subdivision at 1809 and 1813 Lafayette.          
 Ward 6 BPS #107188                               
      APPEAL 8154 - Appeal filed by The           
 Igloo, from the determination of the Building    
 Commissioner in the denial of an occupancy       
 permit authorizing the Appellant to operate a    
 snow cone trailer at 4175 Holly Hills.           
 Ward 13 #AO269-76-03                             
      APPEAL 8155 - Appeal filed by               
 Robertson's Home Day Care, from the              
 determination of the Building Commissioner       
 in the denial of a home occupancy waiver         
 authorizing the Appellant to operate a home      
 day care for 10 children at 3620 Michigan.       
 Ward 20 Home Occupancy Waiver                    
      APPEAL 8156 - Appeal filed by Kathy         
 Turner, from the determination of the Building   
 Commissioner in the denial of a home             
 occupancy waiver authorizing the Appellant       
 to operate a home day care for 7 children at     
 3651 Minnesota.         Ward 20 Home             
 Occupancy Waiver                                 
      In accordance with the provisions of        
 Ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.        
     By authority of the Board of                 
 Adjustment.                                      
      K. Duckworth, Chairman                      
    PUBLIC NOTICE                                 
      A Conditional Use Hearing will be held      
 in Room 208 City Hall at 8:30 a.m. on            
 Thursday, March 13, 2003 on the following        
 conditional uses:                                
      1921 Alfred Avenue - In Home Day            
 Care - (6 Children: 6A-6P M-F) - "C" -           
 Multiple Family Dwelling District. Ward 8        
      3347 Blackstone Avenue - Home               
 Occupancy Waiver - Contracting Company           
 (Office Use Only) - "C" - Multiple Family        
 Dwelling District. Ward 22                       
     2803 Dodier - Home Occupancy

          CITY OF ST. LOUIS                    
          FIRE DEPARTMENT                      
     SEALED PROPOSALS                          
          WANTED                               
 ***Extended Closing Date***                   
       The City of St. Louis Fire Department   
 is seeking information technology to automate 
 fire/rescue record management and reporting.  
 The RFP is available on the Web at:           
 http://stlouis.missouri.org/development/      
 otherprojects/rfp-rfq. Closing time and date: 
 2:00 p.m., Friday, April 11, 2003 (Extended   
 from March 14, 2003).                         
 DEPARTMENT     SUPPLY                            
OF PERSONNEL COMMISSIONER                         
     NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                       
     The Department of Personnel, Room            
100 City Hall, City of St. Louis, Missouri        
announces competitive Civil Service               
examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal   
Service.                                          
The last date for filing an application for the   
following examination is MARCH 14, 2003.          
    AIR POLLUTION INSPECTOR II                    
            Prom./O.C. 8912                       
$32,526 to $48,828 (Annual Salary Range)          
      Vacation, Holidays, Sick Leave, Social      
Security, and Employee Retirement System          
Benefit privileges are provided in addition to    
salary.                                           
      Application forms and further               
information concerning duties of positions,       
desirable and necessary qualifications, relative  
weights of examination components, and            
duration of eligible lists may be secured in the  
office of the Department of Personnel, Room       
100 City Hall. Applications can be submitted      
on the Internet. Visit the city web site          
(www.stlouiscity.com) and link to Jobs with       
the City of St. Louis.                            
                 William C. Duffe, Director       
February 26, 2003                                 
NOTICE TO ALL BIDDERS                             
     CITY ORDINANCE requires that any             
individual or company who performs work           
within the City limits must obtain a Business     
License. This would also apply to businesses      
who employ sales or delivery personnel to         
come into the City. Contracts requiring work      
to be performed in the City will NOT be           
awarded to unlicensed businesses.                 
Please contact the License Collector,             
Room 104 City Hall, St. Louis, Missouri,          
63103 or phone (314) 622-4528. You may            
also refer to our on-line site at                 
www.stlouiscity.com.                              
 Office of the Supply Commissioner,                
 Room 324, City Hall, 1200 Market Street,          
 St. Louis, Missouri 63103, Tuesday,               
 March 4, 2003 - ADVERTISED BIDS will be           
 received by the undersigned to be opened at       
 the office at 12:00 o'clock noon, for the items   
 listed below on the dates specified.              
         Notice to All Suppliers                   
       NOTE: It is the policy of the City of       
 St. Louis that all firms desiring to do business  
 with the City of St. Louis must comply with       
 employment practices that are in accordance       
 with the ordinances of the City of St. Louis      
 and the Mayor's Executive Order promulgated       
 there-under to the end that all Contractors       
 and suppliers of materials and services will      
 offer equal opportunity for employment and        
 job advancement to blacks and other minority      
 groups in the St. Louis Metropolitan area.        
      MONDAY, MARCH 10, 2003                       
  MANDATORY PRE-BID MEETING                        
 FOR SUMMER FOOD SERVICE                           
 PROGRAM FOR 59 DAYS.         THE                  
 MEETING WILL BE HELD AT 11:00 AM                  
 IN ROOM 324, CITY HALL, 1200                      
 MARKET ST., ST LOUIS MO. VENDORS                  
 MUST BE PRESENT AT THE MEETING                    
 IN ORDER TO BID.                                  
      TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 2003                      
      MINOLTA MS 6000 DIGITAL                      
       MICROFORM SCANNER                           
 for furnishing the Recorder of Deeds per          
 Req. #33.                                         
   WEDNESDAY, MARCH 26, 2003                       
  CONTRACT FOR SUMMER FOOD                         
      SERVICE PROGRAM                              
 for a period of 59 days.                          
      Bidders are invited to be present at the     
 opening of bids. Bid results may be available     
 30 days following the date of bid opening. If     
 you desire bid results, please include a self-    
 address, stamped envelope with your bid.          
      The City of St. Louis desires to             
 purchase recycled products whenever               
 possible, especially items containing post        
 consumer waste materials. If your company         
 can supply recycled products, please provide      
 information to this office.                       
      The right to reject any and all bids is
 reserved.                                   
                Freddie L. Dunlap            
                Supply Commissioner          
                (314) 622-4580               
                www.stlouis.missouri.org
